spring.controller

Class SpringController

  • java.lang.Object
    • spring.controller.SpringController

  • @RestController
public class SpringController
extends java.lang.Object
    The main controller for the spring application. Will serve as a listening server to answer the form submission service, calling the @see Engine to start processes.
    Author:
    skner

      Constructor and Description

    • Method Detail

      • getListen

        @RequestMapping(value="/engine_status")
public java.lang.String getListen()
        For testing purposes, verifies whether the engine is active or not.
        Returns:
        A test string, saying whether the engine is waiting or working.

      • addSubmission

        @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:4200")
 @RequestMapping(method=POST,
                value="/send_problem",
                consumes="application/json")
public void addSubmission(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                              Submission submission)
        Adds the submission sent by the user to the engine, so it can start the algorithm processes. This method accepts inputs from a certain origin only.
        Parameters:
        submission - The submission object, converted directly from the user's submitted JSON.

      • addTestSubmission

        @RequestMapping(method=POST,
                value="/send_test_problem")
public void addTestSubmission(@RequestBody
                                                                                                         Submission submission)
        Adds the submission sent by the user to the @see Engine, so it can start the algorithm processes. This method accepts inputs from any testing origin.
        Parameters:
        submission - The @see Submission object, converted directly from the user's submitted JSON.

      • sendResults

        @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:4100")
 @RequestMapping(method=POST,
                value="/request_problem",
                consumes="application/plain-text")
 @ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> sendResults(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String problem)
        Sends results to the chart service, displaying this data to the user.
        Parameters:
        problem - The corresponding problem
        Returns:
        The displaying information
